prompt: Compose a poem on morning fog in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Morn's Murm'rous Mist"

'Twas brillig, and the sloths did gyre
In ulfur depths of morn's murk'd fire,
The fog, a flumplenook, did creep
With stealthy pace, the world asleep.

Beware the snarl of Frumplen's might,
That lurks within the misty light,
The jaws that snap, the claws that cling,
When fog and darkness dance and sing.

The mome, with eyes of glimmer bright,
Didst stumble through the murk'd daylight,
With vorpal sword of sun's pale ray,
To vanquish Frumplen's dismal sway.

But soft! What whispers through the trees?
A gentle breeze that rustles ease,
The fog, a wraith, doth slowly rise,
And Morn, with glory, opens eyes.

Then Frumplen's might doth fade away,
And all, in golden light, doth play.
label: high

prompt: Create a poem about déjà vu in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Vu's Vagrant Visions"

'Twas brillig and the slithy minds
Did gyre and gimble in the cerebral wind;
All whimsy were the neurons' whims
As memories did mingle and confound the brims.

Beware the Vu, my son!
The Vu with eyes of backward glance,
That stalks thy thoughts with wily dance,
And makes thee feel thou'st lived this prance.

One, two! The Vu's elusive stride
Creeps up and whispers in thy ear inside,
"This moment's echoes from the past,
A recollection that will forever last."

He took the vorpal memory in hand;
Long time the manxome Vu he fought—
So dread the feeling of its recurring thought!
He strove to grasp the cause in vain,
But Vu's vagrant visions came again.

Beware the Vu, my son!
It nibbles at thy mind's impression plate,
A phrase, a scene, a fragrance waits,
To declothe reason's sober state.

One, two! The Vu's catching spell
Denies the uncommonness of all that's dwelt;
And, combating logic's common hue,
It fictates what never yet has flew.

'Twas brillig and the slithy minds
Did evince sighs at unfounded Vu in kind;
Yet learned men endeavour to define
That fugitive parlance of the blurred design.
label: medium

prompt: Write a poem about desire path in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Tread of the Errant Feet"

'Twas brillig and the sloping bank
Did call to those who chanced to stray
From pathways straight, where feet did rank
And chose instead the errant way

Beware the Desirer's subtle might
That beckons thee to leave the road
And tread the grass, where none take flight
And few return, with tales bestowed

Frivious whims that danced in brain
 Led footsteps to the shortcut's thrall
Through hillock, dell, and slope in vain
The errant feet did swiftly fall

Beware the gradient's sly design
That draws thee to the slanting line
And once thou start'st, 'tis hard to define
The path that's lost, the one that's thine

'Tis Bandersnatch of human will
That lures thee to the shortcut still
And though 'tis rough, though long, though chill
Thy heart doth yearn to follow still

Long time the grass did bear the scar
Of feet that wandered, lost, afar
And some who passed did whisper low
"Beware, dear traveler, as you go"
label: very_low

prompt: Compose a poem on conference room in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Frabjulorum of the Boardroom Lair"

'Twas brillig and the slithy suits did gyre
In Frabjulorum's hallowed, windowed space
Where mome wrack managers with eyes of fire
Didst conjure up their PowerPoint's stern face

Beware the frumious CEO, my son
With eyes that glowed like embers of a ton
Of fiery passion for the bottom line
He'd vorpalize all opposition in its shrine

He took the vorpal pointer in his hand
Long time the manxome foe of stagnant plans
So rested he, with eyes that gleamed of gold
And burbled forth a torrent to unfold

And as he spoke, the mome wracks did play
Their part, with nods and murmurs of the day
While Frabjulorum's walls did echo and resound
With hollow words that whirled the senses round

But lo, the meeting's end did finally come
The frumious CEO didst give the fatal hum
The slithy suits didst rise and swiftly flee
From Frabjulorum's clutches, wild and free.
label: medium

prompt: Write a poem about map in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
The Cartographer's Flibberflam

'Twas brillig and the sloths did gyre
In the Land of Maps, where wonders fire
Beware the Grid, my son, with scales
And shun the Legend's wily tails

He took the Compass of Desire
In hand, with Pencil's burning fire
And forth he strode, with reckless pace
Through Mountains steep and winding space

Beware the Boulevard's beguiling smile
And shun the one-way Arrow's wile
The Projection's pitfalls, dark and deep
Lurked unseen, where errors creep

He mapped the Cities, grand and fair
And charted Seas, with secrets rare
Through fog and mist, he made his way
And brought the Terrains into day

And when the sun set, in fiery blaze
He marked the Boundaries' twisty ways
And laughed with glee, at his Flibberflam
The Cartographer, lord of the Map's great game.
label: very_low

In Layover Bay, a woeful place
Where delays did grasp with wily face

prompt: Create a poem about screen burn‑in in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Burn of the Glowing Screen"

'Twas brillig and the slithy screens
Didst flicker with a wondrous sheen
Beware the pixel's ghostly stain
That doth afflict the burn-in's bane

Beware the static image's might
That doth sear itself into the night
And when thou dost behold the sight
Of ghostly icons, pale and bright

Beware the OLED's woeful plight
That doth succumb to burn-in's blight
And when thou dost thy screen behold
A ghastly phantom, forever to hold

Thou shalt not gaze upon the screen
With static images, lest thou be seen
To invite the burn-in's dreaded stain
That doth afflict the glowing pane

But rather, use thy screens with care
And vary thy images, beyond compare
Lest thou dost suffer the burn-in's fate
And thy screen, a ghostly specter, create.
label: very_low

prompt: Write a poem about Monte Carlo in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"The Frumious Gambol of Monte Carlo"

'Twas brillig and the slot machines
Did glimmer in the Casino's sheen,
All whimsy were the roulette's spins,
And the croupiers' calls, a madness keen.

Beware the Baccarat's frumious might,
With banker's odds that bite so bright,
And shun the chemin de fer's dread sway,
That beckons thee to risk thy pay.

He chanced upon the Trente et Quarante's lair,
Where fortunes danced, with fate so rare,
A hissing whisper breathed, " Place thy bet",
As Chance, the Cheshire Cat, did sit and fret.

He took the wheel, with skill so fine,
And spun the red, and the black in line,
The ivory ball, in whimsy's dance,
Did settle on the number, of his second chance.

And has thou won, or hast thou lost?
In Monte Carlo's den, of fate, the cost?
Ah, the frumious gambol, that did play,
As he departed, with a sigh, away.
label: very_low

prompt: Compose a poem on stage wings in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Beyond the Velvet Veil"

'Twas brillig and the sloths did gyre
In wings of wonder, dark and dire
Where stagehands scurried, swift and sly
To conjure worlds, and catch the eye

Beware the prompter's whispered spell
That echoes forth, a mystic knell
To beckon forth the hesitant heart
And draw the actor to their part

The flies, a fluttering, frantic host
Did swirl and swoop, with anxious boast
Their silken threads, a-tangle and bright
As they awaited cue, to take their flight

The velvet veil, a secret keep
Did shroud the wings, in mystic sleep
Where magic dwelled, and mystery abode
And only those who knew, did dare to go

Beware the stage, its wiles and guile
That lures the brave, with beguiling smile
For in its wings, where shadows play
Lies the abyss, of a forgotten day.
label: very_low

prompt: Create a poem about brown butter in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"The Frumious Frying of the Browned Butter"

'Twas brillig in the kitchen's gleam,
Where pots and pans did loudly scream,
Beware the butter, brown and bright,
Frumious frying with savory delight.

He took the pan with skillful hand,
And swirled the cream with wondrous command,
Through foam and froth it churned with ease,
As golden hues did slowly seize.

Beware the splatter, hot and wide,
That threatens cooks with painful pride,
And shun the burnt and smoky snare,
That turns the brown to black despair.

'Twas in the skillet's swirling storm,
The butter browned with sweet and piquant form,
A flavor deep, a scent so fine,
That danced upon the nostril's twine.

He served it forth with culinary flair,
A sauce most wondrous, beyond compare,
Frumious frying of the browned butter's might,
A gastronomic pleasure to excite.
label: very_low

prompt: Write a poem about creep in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"The Creep's Caper"

'Twas brillig in the dark of night
The Creep did stir with wicked delight
He snuck and slinked with stealthy ease
Through shadows dancing on the breeze

Beware the Creep, my son, beware
The claws that grasp, the eyes that glare
He'll creep and crawl, with wily guile
And snatch the unwary with a wretched smile

He'd lurk in corners, dark and deep
Where fears and doubts in whispers creep
He'd weave a web of wicked might
And snare the innocent in endless night

The frumious Bandersnatch, with jaws agape
Did chase the Creep, with furious shape
But he escaped, with cunning art
And left the Bandersnatch to gnash and smart

Beware the Creep, my son, beware
For he's a monster, beyond compare
With wiles and tricks, he'll get the best
And leave you shivering, in eternal unrest.
label: very_low

prompt: Compose a poem on awl in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"The Quillious Awl's Vorpal Sway"

'Twas brillig and the sloths did gyre
In the land of sewing, where needles conspire
Amidst the threads of silk and twine so fine,
The quillious awl did glimmer and shine.

Beware the awl, with point so bright,
Lest it prick thy thumb and cause a fright
For in its wake, a trail of holes doth lie,
Like tiny eyes that stare and catch the eye.

In frabjulon shops, where seamstresses weave,
The awl's vorpal sway doth threads conceive
'Tis a tool of art, of craft and of might,
That pierces leather with a deadly bite.

He took the awl in hand, with care and ease,
And pierced the hide with practiced expertise
The quillious awl, a marvel of old,
Did sing a song, of holes to unfold.

Beware, O tailor, of the awl's sharp sting,
Lest thy fine fabric, with holes do start to sing
For in its path, a trail of ruin lies,
And garments rent, with a thousand sighs.
label: very_low

prompt: Create a poem about third rail hum in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Thrum of the Third Rail's Dread"

'Twas brillig and the slithy trains
Did gyre and gimble on the track's remains
Where thrum of third rail's eerie sway
Did whisper secrets, night and day

Beware the frumious humming sound
That vibrates through the platform's ground
A buzzing noise most strange and dire
That warns of voltage, death's dark fire

He chortled in his joy of speed
Who grasped the pole with heedless deed
And felt the thrum of power's might
As trains rushed by, a blurred delight

But lo, the careless, who do stray
Too close to the electrified way
Shall feel the shock of dreadful fate
And hear the thrum of death's dark state

So heed this warning, traveler true
And shun the third rail's humming anew
For in its sound, a danger lies
That only wise and wary eyes
Can see the perils of its sway
And live to ride another day.
label: very_low

prompt: Write a poem about interference in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
Frabuluxious Interference

'Twas brillig and the sloths did gyre
In the tulgey waves of radiance dire
All whimsy were the signals' might
As interference frolicked in the light

Beware the mome's wild frequencies keen
That clash and clatter, whine and sheen
Frabuluxes of discord they sow
And wither sense with cacophony's woe

He took the vorpal filter in hand
Long time the noise he sought to withstand
With galumphing strides he made his way
Through the frumious bands of disarray

He fought the burble, battled the squeal
Resisted the rasp, the shriek, the reveal
With fortitude and cunning guile
He tamed the tumult, made it smile

Now the beam is clear, the sense is bright
The noise, a mere forgotten blight
And he, the victor, holds his ground
In the radiant realm, unbound.
label: medium

prompt: Compose a poem on umbrella in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Frabjulious Folds of Fancy"

'Twas brillig and the slithy rain
Did gyre and gimble in the air
As I grasped my trusty gamp,
The frabjulious umbrella fair.

Beware the frumious wind that blows
Lest it inside-out your brolly throws
And all your gear be drippy wet
As you with sorrowful eyes are met.

The glimmering spokes, a wavy wheel
Did spin and spatter, splash and squeal
The silken dome, a wondrous hold
Against the deluging rain's dark fold.

Beneath its shade I danced with glee
A dry and merry wight, you see
The Frabjulious Folds of Fancy wide
Did safeguard me from rain's wild tide.

But when the wind grew strong and keen
And grasped the handle with a shriek unseen
I feared the gamp would fly away
And leave me to a dismal day.

Yet still I held with all my might
And rode the gusts of rain and night
Till finally the storm did cease
And sunshine lit the wet release.

Oh, frabjulious umbrella of mine
With thee I dare the rain's wild shrine
Thy fanciful and wondrous fold
Shall safeguard me, young and old.
label: medium

prompt: Create a poem about science fair in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Frabjulon's Fantastic Fair"

'Twas brillig and the slithy judges came
To Frabjulon's Fantastic Fair's esteemed name
With clipboards keen and eyes aglow
They sought to find the science secrets to bestow

Beware the Mome Wrack, with test tube tight
And Fimbulflyzer, whirling with delight
Beware the Quizzlewhack, with math so fine
Lest it confound thee, and make thy project decline

All whimsy were the students, with their wares to show
Groggle-eyed and eager, as their judges did go
He took the Vorpal Prism, in his hands so fine
And said, "Explain to me, this wondrous device of thine"

With Galimatias, she did astound
Her display of atoms, spinning round and round
And when the judges asked, with curiosity so bright
She showed them Fizzlewhack, and the wonders of the night

Frabjulon's Fantastic Fair, 'twas a wondrous sight
A snicker-snack of science, shining oh so bright
The slithy judges smiled, with joy and glee
For in this fair of science, wonders waited to be free.

prompt: Write a poem about film camera in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"The Flickerwock's Tale"

'Twas brillig and the slithy light
Did gyre and gimble in the sight
Of lens and shutter, artful might
That captured life in frozen night

Beware the Flickerwock, my son!
The film that feeds its hungry ton
With frames of joy and frames of strife
As shutter clicks and moments rife

Its Kodak scales do glimmer bright
In dark of room or light of night
It snared the snapshots with great art
And in its rolls, a story to start

And, as in chamber of the eye
The emulsion danced, a wondrous sigh
Did echo through the winding wheel
As Flickerwock its secrets did reveal

He took the picture, sword in hand
Of moments lived, of love that stand
And when the roll was done and spent
The Flickerwock its treasures bent

Beware the Flickerwock, I say!
Lest memories fade with end of day
For in its film, a tale is spun
And moments lost, are moments won.
label: very_low

prompt: Create a poem about umbrella in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
The Glibbleglorp's Brolly

'Twas brillig and the slithy rain
Did gyre and gimble in the air
The mimsy pedestrians did complain
Of drips and drops beyond repair

Out came the Glibbleglorp with flair
His brolly swirling, colors rare
A frumious beast with ribs of might
It sheltered him from the wet and white

Beware the snap of windy spite
That breaks the umbrella's slender light
And shun the pools of standing deep
Where mires and muck the foot do keep

The Glibbleglorp's brolly danced with glee
A whimsy whorl of fantasy
It kept him dry from dripping hair
To tripping toes, without a care

He wandered, lost in streets unseen
The brolly's magic guiding him serene
Through glistening gaps and rippling streams
The Glibbleglorp's path was dry and clean

So if thou journeyest on a day
Of drips and drops in disarray
Take heed of Glibbleglorp's bright way
And fetch thy brolly, come what may!
label: medium

prompt: Write a poem about Monte Carlo in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
'Twas Brillig in Monte Carlo's Glare

'Twas brillig in Monte Carlo's glare,
Where roulette wheels spun with whimsy rare,
Beware the Banker, my son, I pray,
With pockets deep and a heart of grey.

He dealt the cards with fingers fine,
And stacks of chips did tantalize mine,
Beware the Croupier's siren call,
That beckons thee to risk thy all.

The Chemin de Fer's a winding stair,
That leads to fortune or to despair,
And in the Salle des Étrangers' haze,
Thou may'st find thy lucky, golden days.

Frabjous fortunes, fleeting and bright,
 Dance in the lights of the Casino's night,
But beware, my son, the gambler's snare,
Lest thou fall prey to chance's cruel air.

Take heed, dear adventurer, of thy fate,
And in the game of chance, participate,
With prudence, lest the odds prevail,
And Monte Carlo's brilliance turn to fail.

'The Cartographer's Quest'

'Twas brillig and the slithy roads did twine

In foreign climes, with aliment of dismay

Beware the Specious Scale, with marks so fine

prompt: Create a poem about film camera in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Snapthystic's Flickerflame"

'Twas brillig and the slithy lenses gleamed
In Snapthystic's hands, a wondrous dream
A film camera, with gears that whirred and spun
Did beckon forth the photic throng, to be begun

Beware the F-stop, my son, with claws so fine
That snatch the light, and leave the dark divine
Beware the Shutter's deadly snap and slice
That freezes time, and makes the moment nice

He took the winding path, through ISO's maze
Where grain and noise, in whispers, dazed
The ASA's spectral hands, that guided him along
Through exposures short, and shutter-speed's sweet song

The frumious Kodachrome, with colors bold
Did dance upon the sensor, young and old
The velvety darks, and highlights' golden glow
Did weave a tapestry, of moments long ago

And when the roll was done, and final frame was shot
Snapthystic smiled, and his heart was not forgot
For in the camera's belly, a secret was stored
A tale of light and shadow, forever implored

Then took the film, to the darkroom's mystic sway
Where chemicals' soft whispers, brought forth the display
The images, like phantoms, on the wall did play
And Snapthystic's eyes, with wonder, did stray.

prompt: Write a poem about music room in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Frabjom's Refrain"

'Twas brillig and the slithy sounds
Did gyre and gimble in the air,
As mome musicians took their rounds,
And practiced with an anxious care.

Beware the Fretborog, my son!
The jaws that bite, the strings that squeal!
Beware the Malletmol, and shun
The thunderous drums that make you reel.

He took the Sticlavion in hand,
With fingers deft and nimble fine,
And played a tune of pure enchantment's stand,
That made the Frumplenooks align.

Long time the Sonorous Serpent wind
Did whisper secrets, wild and free,
Till Flibberflam's Fantasia unwind,
And all the music merged with glee.

He played of joy and sorrow's might,
Of love and loss, and all between,
And as the last note took its flight,
The music room fell still and serene.

And all the instruments did sleep,
Save one small Fiddledee, that wept.

Beware the goblinated sensations cold

prompt: Create a poem about stage wings in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Twas brillig in the Wingèd Shades"

'Twas brillig in the Wingèd Shades,
Where performers pause and tremble waits,
Beware the Stagehand, frumious and slow,
Lest he mistake the cue, and chaos grow.

Beware the Flap, that opes and shuts
With creaky hinge, and dusty nuts,
And shun the Lift, with lanyard coiled,
Lest counterweight thy mortal coil.

And if thou seekest exit, swift and sly,
Beware the Rack, where garments lie,
Tossed, crumpled, in disorder most,
Lest thou be snared, and thy escape lost.

So stay thy feet, dear player, here,
In Wingèd Shade, and heed not fear,
For when thou strik'st, with rehearsed flair,
The Stagehand's skill shall set thee there.

prompt: Write a poem about brown butter in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
'The Frumious Frying of the Brown Butter'

'Twas brillig and the pans were bright,
In the kitchen of a culinary knight,
Beware the brown butter, my son, I pray,
Its flavors frumious, in a most curious way.

He took the pan and with a sizzling sound,
The butter melted, foaming all around,
He stirred and stirred, with a spoon of might,
Till it reached the point of golden delight.

Beware the nuttiness that doth arise,
When browned and toasted, with aromas wise,
For in the kitchen, few have escaped the snare,
Of the brown butter's savory lair.

'Twas brillig and the pans were bright,
As the knight devoured, with most curious bite,
The brown butter's magic, in a frumious treat,
That made his taste buds skip and leap with glee to eat.

So if thou darest, brave culinary knight,
To tempt the brown butter's wondrous, frumious might,
Beware, beware, the flavors that arise,
For in the kitchen, few can resist its tasty surprise.

"Frabjulintrusion"

And renders useless, beyond repair

Beware the Jammerson, with its might
That froths and churns, a confounded blight
It overlays the intended tone
And garbles all, to make unknown

Its manxome coils, a-tremble spin
As gibber.getMin soaks all within
A turgid moistness that befouls the wave
And clogs the channel, a dismal cave

Beware, and shun, the distortions dire
That clog and choke, with wretched fire
Seek the clear stream, the open shore
And avoid the Frabjulintrusion's roar

'Tis done, the Interferer, I say
Hath yielded to the calm of day
The signals flow, in crystal flow
And the receptors hear, with gratitude to know.

Through shadows dark and secret smile

Beware the creep, my son, with care

He stalks with stealth, a silent pace
And fills the heart with troubled space

His mome-like face, a mask of white
Conceals the depths of endless night
His words, a whispered, honeyed spell
That weaves a web of deceit to compel

He creeps, a serpent, slow and cold
Through friendships formed, and trust grown old
His presence seeps, a subtle stain
That spreads and festers, leaving pain

Beware the creep, with cautious eye
And shun his whispered, sweet goodbye
For in his wake, a trail is laid
Of shattered trust, and hearts betrayed.

poem:
"The Awl's Frumious Frenzy"

In the workshop of a wily sire

Awaiting hands to wield by day

Beware the Awl, my son, I pray
With point so fine and temper gray
It pierces leather, swift and sly
And sends the stitching flying high

It whiffling whirled with wizard ease
Through hide and sole, with tricky squeeze
It left a trail of holes so fine
A testament to its design divine

The frumious Awl, with eyes so bright
Did mock the stitcher's meager might
As it slipped and slid with wicked guile
Through every seam, with wily smile

Beware the Awl, with furious spate
Lest it unravel all thy careful state
And leave thee with a tangled mess
And a despair that doth not repress

So take heed, my son, and heed this rhyme
Lest the Awl's frumious frenzy be thy crime.

prompt: Compose a poem on layover bay in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Frabjulon's Cove of Wearied Wings"

'Twas brillig in the layover bay,
Where travelers tarried, lost in dismay,
Their flights delayed, their plans astray,
As they waited for the end of day.

Beware the Slithy Airlines' might,
That cancelled flights with little light,
And shunned the pleas of weary sight,
In Frabjulon's cove, where woe took flight.

The borogoves of baggage claim,
Did gyre and gimble, void of fame,
Their whirring wheels, a maddening game,
As frazzled travelers played the blame.

The mome wraths of missed connections past,
Did mock the stranded, aghast and aghast,
Their shrill cries echoing, a dismal blast,
In Frabjulon's cove, where hope would not last.

But still the travelers held on tight,
To fragile hope, a flickering light,
That somehow, someway, they'd take to flight,
And leave the layover bay's dismal night.

So if thou ever find thyself forlorn,
In Frabjulon's cove, where flights are torn,
Take heart, dear traveler, and hold on strong,
For in the end, thy journey shall be won.

The outgribs of logic, lost on me,

The whimsy trail, a winding stream,
That flows, a force, both wild and serene.

In mystic vapors, swirling, swayed
By wisps of fog that danced and spun
As morning sunbeams had just begun

Beware the snizzlefraze, my son,
With tendrils creeping, softly sprung
Through dewy grass and dripping trees
It weaves a web of vapor's freeze

The burblebats, in whispers, say
"Beware, for fog can lead astray"
But still the slothsomeres, with care
Tiptoe through the misty lair

Their eyes, like lanterns, glowing bright
Pierce through the veil of morning's light
And when the snizzlefraze doth lift
The world, remade, in splendor drift

So heed the warning, traveler, and beware
The misty galimatias, lurking there
Lest, in its swirling vortex, thou
Be lost, till sunrise, shining through.

poem:
"Frabjulious Forums of Fate"

'Twas brillig and the slithy seats
Did gyre and gimble in the hall
All mimsy were the meeting treats
And the frumious flipcharts stood tall

Beware the Whiteboard, my son!
The markers that bite, the ink that flows
Beware the PowerPoint's deadly stun
And shun the Conference Call's dull woes

He took the laser pointer in hand
And forth into the meeting went he
Long time the maxims of Management's stand
Did echo, a tedious reverie

He battled the Agenda's monstrous length
And out-argued the Objections' spite
With "Next steps" and "Action items" of strength
He tamed the Meeting's woeful plight

And when the clock struck coffee break
The room did stir, and voices awake
The Frabjulious Forums of Fate did make
A successful Meeting, no hearts did ache

But oh, beware the Post-Meeting's snare
The Minutes that trap, the Follow-Ups' care
For once the meeting's done and gone
The real work's just begun, anon.

"Vu's Vexing Visions"

Did conjure forth a memory unseen,

 Déjà vu's dread whisper breathed at last.

Beware the Vu, with its eerie might,
That makes the present seem a past delight,
A glitch in time, a wrinkle in the brain,
That brings a shiver, a sense of pain.

'Tis a frumious feeling that doth play,
A trick of the mind, in a most curious way,
A memory that's not a memory at all,
Yet feels as real as a most dire recall.

The Vu's vexing visions, how they tease,
A dance of déjà, in a waltz of freeze,
The mind, a maelstrom, in a whirl of thought,
As the past and present, in a blur, are brought.

That wraps the brain, in a most curious care,
And though it seems a mere fantasy,
 Déjà vu's sting, can be a reality.

poem:
"Melodoria's Mirthsome Maze"

'Twas brill in the soundscapes, and slithy beats
Did gyrate in Melodoria's mystic seats;
Beware the mallets, my son, of the drum's loud might,
Lest in its rhythm, you lose your footing in flight.

The frumious frets of the guitars did gleam,
As the fiddlers' fingers danced with wild esteem;
The pianos' ivory keys, like moonlit waters flow,
Did echo whispers of harmonies long ago.

The mome wracks of melody did frolic and play,
As the cantors' voices soared on a sunlit day;
In midst of the music, a Bandersnatch of sound,
Did lurk, unseen, with discord all around.

He took the mallet, in hand, with a flourish and spin,
And struck the drum, with a resounding din;
The room was filled, with a cacophonous delight,
As Melodoria's maze, became a wondrous, mad sight.

Beware, my son, the Siren's call of the song,
Lest in its beauty, you wander, lost, all day long;
For in Melodoria's mirthsome maze, you may find,
The frabjul joy of music, intertwined.
label: low

prompt: Write a poem about layover bay in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Glibbleglorp at Layover Bay"

'Twas brillig and the sloths did gyre
In the tulgey woods of Layover's shore,
Where glibbleglorp beasts loved to fire
Their snizzlefraze cannons evermore.

Beware the frumplenook, my son,
With jaws that snap and eyes that glaze,
Beware the silentious throng,
That mock the traveler's dismayed gaze.

In Layover Bay's wobblebrook air
The jim-jam falcons learn to stare,
And EFelines dance the snole,
While flights fall late, with lost despair.

The glimmerglass waves crash on the shore
As travelers succumb to flightless fate,
Till mome the brains of sketching rout,
And seeks the exit, rather late.

So pack thy Chimera-repellent spray
And don thy thinker's clockwork wing,
For in Layover Bay's absurd display
Thy madness shall find fleeting sting.

Farewell, then, mortal, take thy chance
And wobblebrook till next plane's dance;
For after that, with signals bright,
Your real journey takes gunshot flight!
label: low

prompt: Compose a poem on conference room in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Borrovemme of Boards"

'Twas brillig and the chairs were fine,
In Borrovemme of Boards, where meetings entwine.
The mome wracks sat, with agendas in hand,
Gyneing and gimbling, as the CEO did stand.

Beware the market trends, with graphs so sly,
That nimbly navigated, did the forecasts lie.
He took the vorpal pointer, with swoop and with swing,
And slew the tedious slides, with a mighty "next thing".

The frumious Bandersnatch of the finance team,
Did gyre and gimble, with spreadsheet's wildest dream.
The borogoves of sales, with powerpoints in tow,
Did maunder and mumble, as the minutes ticked slow.

The burble of the water cooler, a distant hum did sound,
As the jabbering jargonauts, in clusters gath'red round.
And when the meeting ended, with action items assigned,
The frabjulap of decisions, did warm the corporate mind.

Beware the Borrovemme of Boards, with troubles so dire,
Where meetings meander, like a wasteful, wily fire.
label: low

prompt: Create a poem about awl in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Awl of Whimsy's Woe"

'Twas brillig and the sloths did gyre
In the tulgey shop of worn desire
Where mome wrack and toil did play
A curious tool held court by day

Beware the Awl, my son, with eyes
That glimmer bright like snicker's guise
Its pointy tip, a wicked delight
Piercing leather with cruel might

It whiffling came, with wooden handle worn
Through loops and stitches, threads were torn
It frabjulayed with reckless glee
Leaving scraps of fabric to be

Beware the Awl, with pounces sly
Lest it befuddle and make thee cry
For though 'tis small, its wrath is grand
And thy poor seam, a tattered band

So take heed, dear tailor, and beware
The Awl of Whimsy's woe and snare
Lest in its wake, thy fabric lie
In tatters, and thy sanity deny.
label: very_low

prompt: Write a poem about creep in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"The Creep's Lament"

'Twas brillig and the sloths did gyre
In the tulgey woods of online fire,
All whimsy were the avatars bright,
And the mome raths outclick'd with spite.

Beware the Creep, my son!
The flams that bite, the snarks that stun,
He lurks in fora, dark and deep,
Where naiveté doth blindly creep.

One, two, he stalks with stealthy ease,
And with each post, a victim teases,
His words, a snare of sly delight,
Lures the unwary to his spite.

Beware the Creep, my son!
His pixel'd eyes, that glimmer bright,
Like moonlit toads, in cybernight,
Reflect the depths of endless fright.

He haunts the threads, a ghastly guide,
Where unsuspecting souls do reside,
And as they wander, lost and cold,
He strikes, with posts of venom'd gold.

Beware the Creep, my son!
And shun the online dens of scorn,
Lest thou, like others, fall prey,
To his insidious, wicked sway.
label: very_low

prompt: Compose a poem on desire path in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Glintzenstrasse's Beckoning Bane"

'Twas brillig and the sloths did gyre
In Glintzenstrasse's verdant mire
Where pedestrians oft did stray
From paths of right, come what may

Beware the desire path, my son!
The wily route that's oft begun
'Tis tempting, swift, and seems so fine
But leads thee to a troubled shrine

The flumplenooks of habituation
Did whisper sweet the deviation
From sidewalks straight and true of old
To shortcuts oft by few told

The snickering frazles of disdain
Did mock the signs that warned in vain
As travelers with feet of clay
Did follow Glintzenstrasse's way

But oh, the perils of the path untrod!
The mome-like pitfalls to be trod!
The wretched wight who dares to stray
Shall rue the day, come what may

Yet still we heed the siren's call
Of Glintzenstrasse's beckoning thrall
And venture forth, with hearts aflame
Down twisting paths that bear no name.
label: very_low

prompt: Create a poem about morning fog in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Frumious Dawn's Foggious Shroud"

'Twas brillig and the sloths did sway
In misty veils of morning gray
The frumious fog, a wily thief
Stole sunrise with its dampy chief

Beware the snizzle's sly delight
That froths and foams with dewy light
It wraps the world in clammy fold
And darkness reigns, young day grows old

The mome wracks writhed, a spectral band
Dancing in vap'rous, ghostly land
Their wraithy forms, a ghastly crew
Didst caper, hid from mortal view

But when the solstickle struck high noon
The fog, a fleeing, fearful croon
Didst lift, and lo! The sun's warm ray
Didst chase the shadows, come what may

The frumious dawn's foggious shroud
Didst flee, and all the world avowed
The beauty of a cloudless day
In all its splendor, come to stay.
label: low

prompt: Write a poem about third rail hum in the style of Lewis Carroll's 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Galvanic Gyrations"

'Twas brillig and slothsom in tunnelled night
The third rail thrummed with mystic light
A hum of volts in cadent sway
Did beckon trains to speed away

Beware the arc, my son, I pray
That sparks and spits with fervent ray
Lest contact lost, the engine stall
And darkness reign, with eerie call

He took the track, with wary ear
And listened close, without a fear
The galvanic song, a siren's thrall
Did guide him on, through tunnel's hall

Frivolous frizz, a waltzing air
Did dance upon the charged rail there
As ampèrian serpents, twist and play
Conducting force, in merry way

He rode the rail, with skill so fine
And harnessed power, in measured line
Through tunnels black, and hidden deep
The third rail's hum, his spirit did keep.

prompt: Compose a poem on film camera in the style of 'Jabberwocky'. Include a title. Output only the titled poem.
poem:
"Frabjulux F-stop Fancies"

'Twas brillig and the slithy lenses gleamed
In frabjulux light of studio's esteemed
Beam fell on bellows, dark and wide
As cameraman with care did reside

Beware the f-stop, my son, I pray
With aperture so fine, it doth slay
The bokeh, soft and creamy white
Lures victims to a pictorial night

The shutter clicked with vorpal sound
As moments fled, like mome wrack's profound
The roll, a quest of twenty-four
 Frames filled with wonder, or so we implore

He took the lens, with cunning guile
And snapped the portraits, all the while
Of Bandersnatches, wild and free
Their frumious faces, a sight to see

Beware the ISO, my son, I say
For in its depths, the grain doth play
A mimsy game of light and dark
Where artistic merit, doth embark

And when the roll, was done and spent
He took it to, the dark room's bent
Where chemical, and magic spell
Did conjure images, so swell

And thus the cameraman didst stride
With photographs, of Frabjulux pride
A band of art, of whimsy and might
Tamed by the lens, of his frabjulux sight.
